title: Qualcomm Snapdragon 810 gets Cat. 9 LTE support | Trusted Reviews
description: ![]()**Qualcomm has revealed that its fast-approaching[Snapdragon 810chip](https://www.trustedreviews.com/news/qualcomm-offers-a-glimpse-of-the-future-with-snapdragon-810-developer-handset) will support Category 9 LTEcarrier aggregation.**This means the chip’s modem boasts a theoretical maximum download speed of450Mbps.Qualcomm says it managed to achieve these blistering speeds during internaltests with three LTE carriers, each with a bandwidth of up to 20MHz.It also marks the Snapdragon as Qualcomm’s first application processor tosupport Cat. 9 LTE.Alex Katouzian, Qualcomm’s Senior VP of Product Management, said: “QualcommTechnologies continues to be a leader in the mobile industry withcommercialisation of the world’s leading modem technology, delivering fast andreliable cellular data connectivity solutions.”“This provides speedy application performance and feature richness acrossgreater coverage areas enabled by LTE Category 9 connectivity.”He added: “With powerful processors like the Snapdragon 810, we look forwardto continuing to drive LTE innovation in the high tier to ensure exceptionaluser experiences as mobile broadband demand grows.”  * Qualcomm says its new chip will be available to customers in early 2015, andhas been rumoured to debut in the [Samsung GalaxyS6](https://www.trustedreviews.com/news/samsung-galaxy-s6-release-date-rumours-news-specs-and-price), the [LGG4](https://www.trustedreviews.com/news/lg-g4-release-date-rumours-news-specs-and-price), the [Sony Xperia Z4](https://www.trustedreviews.com/news/sony-xperia-z4-release-date-rumours-news-specs-and-price), and the [HTC One M9Hima](https://www.trustedreviews.com/news/htc-one-m9-release-date-rumours-news-specs-and-price).The chip-maker was also keen to point out that its LTE-Advanced modem would bebackwards compatible with ‘all major cellular standards’ including GSM, CDMA,and HSPA+.The news comes just days after Samsung was reported to be [working on its ownExynos chip](https://www.trustedreviews.com/news/samsung-galaxy-s6-to-land-with-cat-10-lte-reports-suggest) capable of supporting Cat. 10 LTE.The current top-tier LTE modem is Cat. 6, which caps out at about 300Mbps,assuming your carrier will provide such generous data speeds.It’s expected Samsung will release two variants of its Samsung Galaxy S6 – onepowered by the Snapdragon 810, and one powered by its custom-built Exynoschip.**Read More:** [Qualcomm refutes claims of Snapdragon 810delays](https://www.trustedreviews.com/news/qualcomm-refutes-claims-of-snapdragon-810-delays)
